number of helpful: 19 of 19 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
6, 2016
												Arma 2: Private Military Company (PMC) is a first person shooter simulation game developed and published by Bohemia Interactive and released in December 2010. PMC follows the events in British Armed Forces (BAF) following the success of Operation Crimson Lance and the gradual withdrawal of British and American forces from Takistan. In this DLC, Ion Incorporated have won a contract to protect United Nations nuclear weapon inspectors as they investigate the abandoned Takistani Nuclear Programme.  Campaign  In PMC's Operation Black Gauntlet, you play as Brian Frost. In BAF, Frost came across as an appealing individual that was cheerful, driven, and was very caring towards the safety of his squad mates. In PMC, Frost gradually develops post-traumatic stress disorder and evolves into a mentally unstable individual because of circumstances in the campaign. Bohemia manages to deliver a story that showcases the change in mindset of Frost from BAF and PMC. The storytelling allowed me to clearly comprehend the issues he was in, the struggle of the overall operation, and how it all affected him. Furthermore, the game includes choices that have consequences and alter the story of the game, which also provides some replayability.PMC features eleven missions. These missions include mediocre cutscenes, a first in the Arma 2 series, which help tell the story and lengthen the game. Furthermore, I completed the campaign in seven hours. Overall, PMC's campaign is fairly standard and for the first half, I was bored. For instance, I waited twenty minutes for the inspectors to complete the objective in mission three. Following mission five, the game did pick up in action and in intensity because it felt like something was finally happen, not just in a waiting pattern.  Issues  I noticed a variety of issues that affect the campaign. For instance, in mission two I was tasked to defend an airport with others. As a side task, I had to kill a sniper in a tower. Following completion, I checked the map, the squad ditched the airport and ran north towards the Nato base, allowing insurgents to occupy the airport. So, bugs like this were very frequent throughout the campaign and I noticed them more in the early portions of the campaign rather than the latter stages.  Conclusion  Private Military Company is an above-average DLC. The highlight of it is in the characterisation of Frost and how he changed from BAF to PMC. The campaign has eleven missions and the first five missions were fairly boring, but needed to provide background towards the operation, while the second half was much better as it picked up in intensity. There are issues that affect the game, affecting my experience of it. I recommend this on sale. It's fun and it provides a story, even if not a good one. If you have to choose between Arma 2 DLC, I would recommend British Armed Forces, then this, then the Czech Republic DLC.  Rating  5.75/10  Pros  - Characterisation of Brian Frost.- Insight into contractors and the severity of their operations.- Choices matter.  Cons  - Annoying bugs that significantly affect certain missions.If you found this review helpful, please give it a thumbs up. If you would also like to follow my reviews more easily, be sure to join my group Antwog's Analysis (Reviews).

er 29, 2015
												I recommend this DLC, if you really want more ArmA 2.  Compared to ALL the other campaigns, this one is the most lacking.  You're better off playing any of the other campaigns first.  But given its frequently discounted price, I think it's well worth it.ProsMore ArmaActually has a story, unlike Arma 2: Army of the Czech RepublicConsThe story, IMO, feels like something DICE (Battlefield developer) would come up with.  Just doesn't seem very realistic.Along the same lines, the characters are so odd.  Sometimes they are clueless and other times they are decisive.Since when can 5 sniper shots blow up a tank?  Pretty dumb.  Again, it feels like DICE came up with this stuff.  Some of the missions are bugged, this isn't new to ArmA and generally things do work out.

content:
ber 23, 2012
												Private Military Company opens up ArmA 2 to a new independent faction, the PMCs. The campaign, unlike BAF, is cooperative and the pack adds in Proving Ground, new units, weapons, and vehicles. However, I feel this is the weakest of the DLCs. The new vehicles are pretty boring, which comes with the nature of PMCs and the campaign is fairly weak. It feels like the designers were trying to add more flair and emotional involvement to the campaign, and while it didn't work out well, it was appreciated. I still recommend it, but if you're only getting two DLC packs, this one should be the one you exclude.

												It's not about nations, or ideologies.It's not even about profit, resources, or ethnicity.It's an endless series of proxy battles,fought by mercenaries and machines.War, and its vast consumption of human life,has become a rational, well-oiled business transaction.War has changed.ID-tagged soldiers carry ID-tagged weapons,use ID-tagged gear.Nanomachines inside their bodiesenhance and regulate their actions.Genetic control.. Information control..Emotion control.. Battlefield control.Everything is monitored, and kept under control.War has changed.The age of deterrence is now the age of control,averting catastrophe from weapons of mass destruction.And he who controls the battlefield, controls history.War has changed.When the battlefield is under total control,war becomes routine.

content:
y 9, 2016
												For the record It mounts onto Arma 2: Operation Arrowhead thus the low play time on it individually.Unlike Arma 2 this expansion has a terrible singleplayer which should not be played. Thankfully thats not all this brings. This version of the admittedly terrible Take On Helicopter Engine adds decent color corection to the engine and GREATLY improves the texture quality. People who only wan't it for DayZ Mod will certainly see a huge diffrence. Setting texture quality to Very High once this is installed will actually improve the texture quality of world textures in Arma 2 OA and It's a must have if you play DayZ as the default "Survivor","Hero" and "Bandit" player models are actually just one of the many PMC models which otherwise will look blurry. This is a must buy if your characters have nasty smeared textures that wouldn't look out of place in a PSP game. It also adds more weapons and will increase the variety of weapons AND adds more loot to be found in DayZ mod

I enhoyed them. But content (Weapons + Vehicle wise) was just bulls***. Lack of content in this dlc is quite poor. Comming back to the campgin, in the 5th mission you have to lead a car, to follow you. I TOOK ME 1 HOUR TO GET TO MY DESTINATION Which was, idk 300 meters AWAY?It was also nice to see that the proving grounds map was being used aswell, which no arma mission HAD Proving grounds as their map.Overall, i got to give this a negative review. Installer is fine (Unlike ACR). But get it if you want to feel the pain. I know people will disagree with this. But it is my opinionn and my dignity.

content:
7, 2012
												If you have to choose between PMC and British Armed Forces, pick BAF. The new assault rifles in the PMCDLCDLC are not as veritable or cool as the L85s in the BAFDLCDLC (or BAFEPDLC if you want to get technical). The PMCEPDLC's (oh Jesus someone stop me) main campaign features awful voice acting with far too much swearing to not be silly but the missions themselves are very fun. Also, there's an Irish guy named Tanny who speaks in completely ridiculous Irish-stereotype jargon weirdness. His weird verbal mannerisms ARE worth mentioning in a review, because they are so outlandish (or highlandish *rimshot*) that the in game subtitles actually change what he says into understandable English, almost like he's speaking another language. There's more "lads" and "wee" sized things per sentence than in Pixar's Brave. Anyway, enough about Haggis McHaggis. The AA12 automatic shotgun is pretty sweet, but YOU BEST NOT BE FIRIN'IT IF YE GOT WEE SIZED STONES, LADDY OWN'N REAL GROW-ED UP MEN CAN FIR'IT
